metadata.title: CVE-2022-48434 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
libavcodec/pthread_frame.c in FFmpeg before 5.1.2, as used in VLC and otherproducts, leaves stale hwaccel state in worker threads, which allowsattackers to trigger a use-after-free and execute arbitrary code in somecircumstances (e.g., hardware re-initialization upon a mid-video SPS changewhen Direct3D11 is used).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48434` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra60 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavcodec60 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavdevice60 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra9 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavfilter9 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavformat-extra60 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavformat60 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavutil58 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libpostproc57 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libswresample4 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libswscale7 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1').
